title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 October 2012 - XWiki

09:34 <vmassol> since fabio is not here yet, I'll sneak in a last commit which is not dangerous :  
09:34 <vmassol> :)  
09:35 <cdop> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <cdop> bon jour. Ctrl+G is mapped in Firefox to "Search page", so... why even display it in the Quick Links if it wont work? ;)  
09:39 <vmassol> cdop: works for me  
09:39 <vmassol> (I'm on mac with FF)  
09:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <cdop> well i am on windows 7, german, and FF shows the search-bar at the bottom with Ctrl G and(!) Ctrl F... strange!  
09:44 <vmassol> just change the mapping maybe  
09:44 <vmassol> in FF  
09:44 <vmassol> in any case we can't make it work by default for all configs  
09:44 <vmassol> people have all sorts of FF extensions  
09:45 <cdop> hmm didnt do any remapping, just have chatzilla, firebug, user agent switcher and web developer as extensions installed  
09:48 <cdop> here we go: its a standard shortcut of FF: http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/keyboard-shortcuts-perform-firefox-tasks-quickly#w\_search  
09:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <cdop> le meme en francais: http://support.mozilla.org/fr/kb/raccourcis-clavier#w\_recherche  
09:56 <vmassol> would need to ask others about it  
09:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you using FF?  
09:57 <vmassol> cdop: I'm personally using chrome (just tested on FF for you)  
09:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
09:57 <vmassol> does ctrl+g work for you?  
09:57 <tmortagne> yep  
09:58 <tmortagne> both on Ubuntu and Windows XP that I tested recently  
09:58 <tmortagne> maybe there is something special with windows 7  
09:58 <tmortagne> wait  
09:58 <tmortagne> what http://support.mozilla.org/fr/kb/raccourcis-clavier#w\_recherche s saying is that ctrl+G goes to the next search  
09:59 <tmortagne> so you probably need to be in "search mode" first  
09:59 <tmortagne> cdop: did you tried without the search bar ?  
09:59 <tmortagne> I mean when the search bar is not visible  
09:59 <tmortagne> trying  
10:00 <tmortagne> hmm  
10:00 <tmortagne> note that ctrl+g does not work in xwiki.org home page for me  
10:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <tmortagne> but works well on other pages  
10:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: XWIKIORG-40  
10:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
10:08 <tmortagne> I tested with search bar and indeed ctrl+G go to the next  
10:08 <vmassol> brb  
10:08 <tmortagne> so when you have the search bar displayed you can't use ctrl+g indeed in FF  
10:09 <tmortagne> cdop: would be nice if you could report an issue about it on http://jira.xwiki.org  
10:09 <tmortagne> I don't know if we will fix it but at least it will be somewhere explained for reference  
10:12 <cdop> ok, gonna do :)  
10:15 <tmortagne> thanks  
10:15 <cdop> well there are already some related reports: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7559 http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKIORG-40  
10:16 <cdop> but i open a fresh one, as it affects firefox (the official supported browser), right?  
10:19 <vmassol> has quit  
10:21 <tmortagne> cdop: those two are different  
10:21 <tmortagne> there is several officially supported browser and FF is one of them yes  
10:22 <cdop> here we go: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1246  
10:23 <tmortagne> ok  
10:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <vmassol> cdop: The reason for XWIKIORG-40 is the carrousel, that's specific to xwiki.org  
10:24 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:32 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <mflorea> has quit  
10:32 <fmancinelli> Hello all  
10:33 <cdop> hmm, cant find out how to deactivate the firefox search bar... and I mean the bottom one, the "in page search". (Ctrl-F)  
10:34 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <vmassol> fmancinelli: hi  
10:38 <tmortagne> cdop: you should have  a cross on the bottom left  
10:38 <tmortagne> at least I have  
10:38 <tmortagne> just before "Find"  
10:41 <vmassol> fmancinelli: don't forget to update http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan43M1 as you progress :)  
10:42 <vmassol> hmm 2 rest test failures  
10:42 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/1855/testReport/org.xwiki.test.rest/WikisResourceTest/testLuceneSearch/  
10:42 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/1855/testReport/org.xwiki.test.rest/WikisResourceTest/testGlobalLuceneSearch/  
10:42 <vmassol> ok I know why:  
10:42 <vmassol> 2012-10-22 23:25:25,666 [Core extension repository updater] WARN  .DefaultPlexusComponentManager - Failed to write resolution tracking file /tmp/jetty-0.0.0.0-8080-xwiki-\_xwiki-any-/xwiki-temp/aether-repository/org/xwiki/rendering/xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/4.3-SNAPSHOT/resolver-status.properties  
10:42 <vmassol> java.io.FileNotFoundException: /tmp/jetty-0.0.0.0-8080-xwiki-\_xwiki-any-/xwiki-temp/aether-repository/org/xwiki/rendering/xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/4.3-SNAPSHOT/resolver-status.properties (Too many open files)  
10:42 <vmassol> too many open files  
10:43 <vmassol> that's strange for a build  
10:43 <vmassol> since the instance shouldn't be up for a long time  
10:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe you could check this one: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-4.2/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/130/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testSimpleSearch/  
10:47 <vmassol> 2 other tests failiing on ui tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1731/  
10:48 <cdop> tmortagne: yeah and when i click it, the search bar disappears. when i press Ctrl-G it reappears ;)  
10:49 <tmortagne> cdop: hmm actually I don't even need to close it, I just need to put the focus on the content and I can use ctrl+G  
10:50 <tmortagne> but I'm not on Windows, maybe there is a difference here  
10:50 <vmassol> btw cdop there are 2 keys I think. At least on mac I can hit either ctrl+g or command+g  
10:51 <tmortagne> I think that's specific to mac  
10:51 <tmortagne> there is only one mapping in XWiki but two method that produce the same key on mac  
10:51 <vmassol> found this:  
10:51 <vmassol>     this.shortcuts = {  
10:51 <vmassol>       "show" : { method : this.showDialog, keys : ['Ctrl+G', 'Meta+G']},  
10:51 <vmassol>       "close" : { method : this.closeDialog, keys : ['Esc']}  
10:51 <vmassol>     },  
10:52 <vmassol> I don't know what meta is on windows but you can try several modifier key...  
10:52 <fmancinelli> AFAICS we should be all OK except some test failings in : xwiki-enterprise-test-feature-portlet, xwiki-enterprise-test-ui, xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-IE8  
10:52 <vmassol> portlet is ok  
10:52 <vmassol> it's a branch  
10:53 <fmancinelli> ok  
10:53 <vmassol> IE8 is ok too since ATM it's always failing, sburjan needs to fix that ASAP it's misleading  
10:53 <fmancinelli> ok  
10:54 <fmancinelli> ok, so only 2 tests failing on xwiki-enterprise-test-ui  
10:54 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <vmassol> yes, and they were not failing consistenytly yesterday so I'd say it's ok you can go on. We still need to fix them, they're a pain  
10:56 <fmancinelli> ok  
10:57 <fmancinelli> so I will validate the "verify that no tests are failing on the CI Server (or that failures are understood)" on the release plan.  
10:57 <vmassol> ok  
10:57 <vmassol> jvdrean still has 2 issues to document  
10:58 <vmassol> (before you can mark the next 2 steps as done)  
10:58 <vmassol> you can do "Release JIRA versions for the following JIRA projects:" though  
10:59 <vmassol> you can continue progressing in the meantime  
10:59 <jvdrean> vmassol, indeed I need to write the "write a component in the wiki" tutorial  
10:59 <fmancinelli> yep. ok I will do the JIRA thing  
11:00 <vmassol> rest tests back to normal (thomas manually started the build)  
11:03 <sburjan> vmassol: I wrote on the channel several times, I don't how to fix the Jenkins agents. IE8 and IE9 are always failing, I don't know the reason  
11:05 <sburjan> the xwiki server is stopped \_before\_ all tests finish running. I have no idea how this can happend  
11:07 <vmassol> same for me  
11:07 <vmassol> and for everyone probably  
11:07 <vmassol> what you need to do to progress is to investigate  
11:08 <sburjan> yes, but I don't have any idea s on how to start. It's the same on IE9 also, so it is either a configuration issue, or some suspect bug  
11:08 <vmassol> check all different errors  
11:08 <vmassol> try to find common thing  
11:08 <cdop> "tmortagne [#xwiki] cdop: hmm actually I don't even need to close it, I just need to put the focus on the content and I can use ctrl+G" - well maybe it is on mac different.  
11:09 <vmassol> look at stack trace  
11:09 <vmassol> read associated code  
11:09 <vmassol> do some tests locally  
11:09 <vmassol> (to see if you can reproduce locally)  
11:10 <vmassol> for ex http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-IE8/320/console seems completyely different  
11:10 <vmassol> and it seems to be a permission error  
11:10 <vmassol> on 322, the problem is that the xwiki instance was not stopped by the previous run: XWiki server is already started!  
11:11 <vmassol> so we need to modify the code to make sure it's stopped all the time  
11:11 <vmassol> this is a problem we have also for non IE tests I believe  
11:11 <vmassol> then for:  
11:12 <vmassol> Caused by: org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException: Failed to navigate to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register. This usually means that a call to the COM method IWebBrowser2::Navigate2() failed. (WARNING: The server did not provide any stacktrace information)  
11:12 <vmassol> Command duration or timeout: 16 milliseconds  
11:12 <vmassol> you need to debug somehow to find what is the problem. Easiest for that is to reproduce locally  
11:15 <fmancinelli> I think Enygma` could commit his comment to the CLIRR exclude so that I can start building a and releasing stuff. (This is the only thing missing before I can close the first item)  
11:16 <fmancinelli> or I can do it actually  
11:27 <fmancinelli> Enygma`, I am committing the comment to CLIRR exclude and proceed  
11:31 <fmancinelli> done  
11:32 <fmancinelli> I'll start the fun part now :)  
11:32 <vmassol> gl  
11:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: a pity we cannot tell easily from outside the rendering if there's been a rendering error when rendering the page (when a macro fails to execute for ex)  
11:41 <vmassol> I would need this in the ircbot.. all I can do now is some hack by checking the transformed XDOM  
11:41 <vmassol> (and look for some "xwikirenderingerror" class specified in a format block)  
11:41 <tmortagne> we could introduce a ErrorBlock  
11:41 <vmassol> hehe  
11:41 <vmassol> I think I had one before  
11:41 <vmassol> and we removed it  
11:41 <tmortagne> don't remember it  
11:42 <vmassol> still  
11:42 <vmassol> we could also pass the information in the rendering onctext  
11:42 <vmassol> well transformation context here  
11:42 <vmassol> set it  
11:42 <tmortagne> another way would be to log errors in the transformationcontext  
11:42 <vmassol> so that from the outside you could check it  
11:42 <tmortagne> like merge do  
11:42 <tmortagne> with mergecontext  
11:43 <vmassol> yup, or both  
11:43 <tmortagne> yes the transaformation context would pass it to rendering context  
11:43 <vmassol> no I mean  
11:43 <tmortagne> another way is to directly log and expect the log to be isolated  
11:44 <vmassol> have the error block + the information in the txcontext  
11:44 <tmortagne> like EM jobs are doing  
11:44 <tmortagne> the error block is required anyway  
11:44 <vmassol> I'm not sure we need to save the errobloc k in the txcontext  
11:44 <vmassol> but what would help is save the fact that there's been an error  
11:44 <tmortagne> not save the error block  
11:44 <vmassol> once you know there's been an error you can easily retrive the error block  
11:44 <tmortagne> have the error block in the XDOM  
11:45 <tmortagne> in the context all we need is log  
12:06 <fmancinelli> I hope the release-translations.sh is re-startable without too much hassle, because the translations download seems to be stuck :)  
12:09 <vmassol> has quit  
12:11 <fmancinelli> it got unstuck... proceeding  
12:16 <evalica> has quit  
12:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <fmancinelli> I don't quite understand the warning  "If this is the first release on a new branch, you will have to edit each repository git configuration to add the new branch" in the release plan explanation... Is 4.3M1 a first release on a new branch? AFAIU no, but maybe I have misunderstood something  
12:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:20 <tmortagne> it's not a new branch since it's master ;)  
12:34 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
12:53 <mflorea> has quit  
14:01 <fmancinelli> when running release-translations.sh commit script I got some rejected errors on some branches: ! [rejected]        stable-3.5.x -> stable-3.5.x (non-fast-forward)  -  ! [rejected]        stable-4.0.x -> stable-4.0.x (non-fast-forward)  
14:01 <fmancinelli> not sure what should I do  
14:02 <vmassol> fmancinelli: make sure you check the trnaslations too (whatever you can, there are often errors)  
14:02 <fmancinelli> I did it, as much as possible  
14:02 <vmassol> ouch  
14:03 <vmassol> just checked the first one  
14:03 <vmassol> and it's wrong  
14:03 <vmassol> :(  
14:03 <fmancinelli> ah  
14:03 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/70c95914fbab2e26b55596617101b52bff139645  
14:03 <vmassol> -  <hidden>true</hidden>  
14:03 <vmassol> +  <hidden>false</hidden>  
14:03 <vmassol> that's pretty bad  
14:03 <vmassol> it breaks a feature  
14:03 <vmassol> stop it bot!  
14:03 <vmassol> pfew  
14:03 <vmassol> glad I checked  
14:04 <fmancinelli> hmmm maybe it's the mvn xar:format I run  
14:04 <vmassol> nope  
14:04 <vmassol> it's l10n  
14:04 <vmassol> misbehaving  
14:05 <fmancinelli> ok, so I have to set them back to true  
14:05 <vmassol> the only thing that should be changed are translations themselves  
14:06 <vmassol> maybe we've not run mvn xar:format on all XARs too that's possible but that's a different topic and can be executed separately  
14:06 <vmassol> (should be executed separately)  
14:07 <vmassol> I don't really know the status of l10n, tmortagne?  
14:07 <vmassol> this makes it very dangerous  
14:07 <tmortagne> what you mean by status ?  
14:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: see above  
14:07 <vmassol> about the hidden docs  
14:07 <tmortagne>  <hidden> is new  
14:08 <tmortagne> so it has not been added to l10n  
14:08 <vmassol> well we've had alreayd at least one release  
14:08 <tmortagne> it's not a bug just that false is the default  
14:08 <vmassol> ok it's a bug for us then  
14:08 <vmassol> it almost caused a regression  
14:08 <vmassol> (if I hadn't caught it, we would have had it)  
14:09 <vmassol> the minimum is to add a big {{error}} macro in the doc fmancinelli about it till we fix it on l10n  
14:09 <vmassol> I don't know how hard it is to fix  
14:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's probably easy to fix l10n simply does not call setHidden  
14:18 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <fmancinelli> vmassol: so to sum up, l10n is not setting the hidden flag, mvn xar:format cleans things up removing several unneeded modifications but it adds the hidden attribute with the default value = false which is bad in our case  
14:23 <vmassol> no  
14:23 <vmassol> mvn xar:format doesn't touch the hidden attribute  
14:23 <vmassol> it couldn't  
14:23 <vmassol> how would it know what to put?  
14:23 <vmassol> whether a doc is  hidden or not is a user decision  
14:24 <vmassol> it's l10n that wrongly always set the hidden flag to false  
14:25 <fmancinelli> ok, so the TIP I added in the release plan explanation is still valid  
14:25 <vmassol> what tip?  
14:25 <vmassol> didn't see it  
14:26 <fmancinelli> this: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp?viewer=changes&rev2=22.1  
14:26 <vmassol> yes  
14:26 <vmassol> l10n should also use the same formatting when generating the xml files  
14:27 <vmassol> (ideally)  
14:27 <vmassol> its more than a tip  
14:27 <vmassol> we need to do so  
14:27 <vmassol> to do so = call mvn xar:format  
14:27 <vmassol> since AFAIK l10n will not generate pretty-formatted xml  
14:28 <vmassol> and if you commit what you get from it then you make a mistake, removing the formatting in git  
14:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: again l10n does not set hidden flag, false is just the default  
14:39 <tmortagne> l10n is not responsible for the formating  
14:39 <vmassol> it's the same  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's using packaging plugin  
14:39 <vmassol> from the outside what we get out of l10n is some xml with hidden set to false  
14:40 <vmassol> I'm not looking for a culprit  
14:40 <vmassol> just stating the fact  
14:53 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:23 <fmancinelli> ok, I started the maven-release.sh script...  
15:46 <sburjan> jvdrean1: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8364  
15:51 <vmassol> jvdrean1: adding the verificaiton in the functional test of the user profile would be good for this  
16:07 <cdop> 4.2 i dont have "save"-button when i try to save accessrights?! how to save the made selections?  
16:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems your proxy fix works after all ;)  
16:10 <vmassol> (maybe the issue should be closed for 4.3M1?)  
16:10 <vmassol> (see Jeremie's email)  
16:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: ha cool did not seen the mail, checking  
16:12 <tmortagne> closing it indeed  
16:26 <cdop> sorry for my question, just found out what went wrong (changed the space)  
16:29 <Inge-> this was weird. I just did the debian package install, fixed permanentDir, did the installation from the distribution center or what it is called, restored mysql and files backed up, could log in as myself. When I logged in as Admin, I got the distribution screen again.  
16:50 <cdop> "App Within Minutes" is really great :) Question: Can I put such an app inside a space (for rights-management)?  
17:03 <vmassol> cdop: AWM is located in a space already  
17:03 <cdop> ah ok, so no space within spaces :)  
17:04 <vmassol> so you can already set rights on that space  
17:04 <vmassol> what's your use case?  
17:04 <vmassol> maybe what you're looking for is workspaces?  
17:05 <cdop> well i am going to have lots of "appwithinminutes"... this time a listing of all our cgis and stuff, another as listing all our database-tables and so on.  
17:05 <cdop> could do this as regular wiki-pages, but i like the features of the appwithin minutes... sortable table and such  
17:05 <vmassol> no no  
17:05 <vmassol> when you create an app with AWM it puts your new app in a space  
17:05 <cdop> wrong approach?  
17:06 <vmassol> so each app created has its own space  
17:06 <cdop> ok, thanks.  
17:06 <vmassol> Enygma`: could you have a look at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application there's some problem on the page. Also I'm wondering why we don't have more screenshots showing off the great feature of workspaces?  
17:07 <vmassol> Enygma`: wait 2 mn, I'll reimport the extension first  
17:13 <vmassol> Enygma`: done
